qas.question: What is at both ends of the transcribed pre-mRNA?
Where are the ribosome binding site, terminator and start and stop codons located on transcribed pre-mRNA?
What do most eukaryotic open reading frames contain?
What dictates the splice sites to generate the final mature mRNA?

answers.text: The sequences at the ends of the introns

qas.question: What encodes the protein or RNA product?

answers.text: the splice sites to generate the final mature mRNA

context: The transcribed pre-mRNA contains <a0_0><a1_0>untranslated regions<a1_0/><a0_0/> at both ends which contain a ribosome binding site, terminator and start and stop codons. In addition, most eukaryotic open reading frames contain <a2_0>untranslated introns<a2_0/> which are removed before the exons are translated. <a3_0>The sequences at the ends of the introns<a3_0/>, dictate <a4_0>the splice sites to generate the final mature mRNA<a4_0/> which encodes the protein or RNA product.
